results.title: Pageant of the high country
results.brief_description: North eastern Victoria, a land of rugged mountains and fertile valleys takes on a variety of aspects with changes in weather. As the winter snows melt, cattle are taken to graze on the lush plains of Mount Dargo and Bogong, under the supervision of the Soil Conservation Authority. The Kiewa hydro-electricity plant harnesses the waters of the mountain rivers. In winter it becomes a popular playground for ski enthusiasts.

results.title: Paganini strikes again
results.creator_credit: Cyril Randell, CFF Productions and Gerry O'Hara
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Benjamin Lee. This story tells of Mike and Bill, who on returning from a violin lesson, get stuck in a lift and by chance see a clue to a criminal’s identity - his feet. Should they tell the police? And why is the strange boy in their form so scared?

results.title: Paderewski playing his Minuet followed by Beethoven's Moonlight Sonata
results.brief_description: The famous pianist, Paderewski, plays Beethoven’s Nocturne in C sharp minor, Opus 27 (better known as the “Moonlight Sonata”), and his own composition, Paderewski’s Minuet in G. Contains interesting footage of the audience and the wonderful “art deco” venue.

results.title: Paddleboats of the Murray River
results.creator_credit: Roy Mason, John Mabey, Rhonda Mabey and Sorena Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Land Australia with Ted Egan”.
Ted Egan’s story of the Paddlewheelers of the mighty Murray River begins at Mannum in South Australia which claims to be the oldest of the riverboat towns. Ted travels on almost all the paddlewheelers beginning with “The Adelaide”. At Mildura a special race is staged for the new and old paddleboats featuring “The Melbourne”, “The Rothbury”, “The Avoca”, “The Coonawarra” and “The Murray River Queen”. At Swan Hill we see “The Gem”, “The Pyap” and a replica of the steam driven “Emmy Lou”. At Echuca Ted travels aboard the “Pevensey”, “The Adelaide” and the “Etona” and an old missionary boat.

results.title: Paddle to the sea
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, ONF | NFB and Bill Mason
results.brief_description: A children’s odyssey, from the story by Holling C. Holling. A film about a little Indian in a canoe, hand-carved in the northern forest and, in the spring, launched towards the sea. There are many adventures, all photographed with great patience and an eye for the beauty of living things. The film gives vivid impressions of Canada’s varied landscape and the life of its waterways. Commentary by Stanley Jackson. Awards: ten awards including Philadelphia; Oscar nomination, Hollywood.

results.title: Paddington turns detective
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington receives a torch from Mr Gruber as a gift and receives an answer to his morse code signals from Mr. Brown’s greenhouse! He assumes the identity of Feathers Locke, Detective and proceeds to investigate, even fingerprinting Mr. Brown’s prize marrow! Adapted from Michael Bond’s book ‘More about Paddington’. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Music by Herbert Chappel.
